result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Tyrone M Gister

Status conference on January 17, 2023 at 08:30 am.

9:12 AM Defendant Tyrone M Gister in court, in custody.  Attorney Laura Ann Walker Esq in court for Tyrone M Gister.  Prosecuting attorney Raymond Robert Rutz III in court for the State of Wisconsin. Court Reporter:  Nancy Szeklinski. 
Defense has spoke with the State again regarding discovery and the issue is with the State as not all discovery has been received, waiting on videos.
BTC: Someone from the DA's either DA Hanson or DDA Jensen to come to Court and explain what is going on with discovery.
Defense moves to modify bond.
BTC: All bonds are reinstated.
Status conference scheduled for January 17, 2023 at 08:30 am.

Defense states that all discovery on 3 files received, however, tendered a stipulation to the State this morning on other discovery. Defendant concerned about a bond forfeiture hearing and he was never notified of the date.
Defendant to submit information regarding bond forfeiture.

9:16 AM Prosecuting attorney Jennifer Tanck-Adams in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Tyrone M Gister in court, in custody.  Attorney Laura Ann Walker Esq in court for Tyrone M Gister. Court Reporter Mark Garvin. 
Waiver of Preliminary hearing filed.  Probable cause found;  bound over.
